intro: Stenophragma falcatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed piper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species.
